cluster_relations.rel_desc: Democratization of information sparks important conversations.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Digital Information & Communication in Contemporary Society

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Democratization of information leads to debates on social issues.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Digital Information & Communication in Contemporary Society

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a causal factor that brings about or gives rise to the object.
args.justification: Both relations describe democratization of information bringing about downstream outcomes (important conversations, debates on social issues). This is a direct causal predicate from subject to object, so a normalized, directionally clear canonical name 'causes' fits both instances.

These relations represent a general family where one phenomenon produces or shapes another (democratization of information leading to discourse outcomes). Grouping them under a broader class 'causal_effect_relation' captures this family beyond the specific canonical predicate.

The hint type and descriptions explicitly state a cause–effect relationship (democratization of information leads to/sparks conversations and debates), which falls squarely under a broad CAUSALITY group.
